definition: to take in/to absorb/to assimilate/to act for/to take a photo/photo shoot/photo/to conserve (one's health)
various genera of flowers of Asteracea family (daisies and chrysanthemums), including Atractylis lancea

sentences.english: It was after Opium War that Western photography was introduced into China.
sentences.chinese: 摄影术是鸦片战争后由西方传入我国的。

sentences.english: He was the earliest person to succeed in shooting portraits with use of photography on glass.
sentences.chinese: 他以玻板摄影术最早成功地拍摄人物肖像。

sentences.english: A photographer must learn photography , thus he could take nice photographs .
sentences.chinese: 一名摄影师必须学过摄影术，这样他才能拍好照片。

sentences.english: There is much debate about who invented photography;
sentences.chinese: 那么，到底是谁发明了摄影术？

sentences.english: His book on colour photography exhausted the subject.
sentences.chinese: 他那本关于彩色摄影术的书写得全面透彻。

sentences.english: Those who specialise in high-speed photography are masters of patience.
sentences.chinese: 高速摄影术方面的专家必定是一个有耐性的大师。

sentences.english: And I try to use chemical testing methods to explore photography.
sentences.chinese: 尝试用化学试验的方法对摄影术进行探索。

definition: Wilhelm Conrad Röntgen (1845-1923), German mechanical engineer
Gutenberg (name)/Johannes Gutenberg (c. 1400-1468), inventor in Europe of the printing press/Beno Gutenberg (1889-1960), German-born US seismologist, coinventor of the Richter magnitude scale
Leonardo da Vinci (1452-1519), Italian Renaissance painter
